summary: This document is a collection of Bureau of Prisons administrative forms from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, dated August 10, 2019. It includes inmate count sheets, out-count forms, and inmate rosters, which are standard prison operational records. The significance lies in the date, as it is the day Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at this facility.

events.title: Prison Count Operations
events.description: Routine inmate counts and administrative record-keeping at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, New York
keyFacts: These are standard Bureau of Prisons administrative forms (count sheets, rosters) from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.
The documents are dated August 10, 2019, the day Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the MCC.
The inmate rosters list several inmates, including two (Mersey and Weber) marked with 'SUICIDE OR' watch designations.
The forms show the routine operational procedures for tracking inmate location and population within the facility.
The documents themselves do not mention Jeffrey Epstein by name, but their date and origin are directly relevant to the circumstances of his death.
